Class GuidedModeMenu

java.lang.Object
Menus.GuidedModeMenu
public class GuidedModeMenu extends Object
The GuidedModeMenu class provides a user interface to guide the user through the process of setting up a VLAN network for an office building in Guided Mode. The user is led through a series of steps to configure various network devices and connections.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Izzy Kavanagh

  • Method Details

    • mainMenu

      public static void mainMenu(Scanner scanner, Topology topology, NetworkManager manager, List<Router> routers, List<Computer> computers, List<Switch> switches, List<DHCPServer> dhcpServers, List<DNSServer> dnsServers, List<WebServer> webServers, int mode)
      Displays the main menu and guides the user through the VLAN setup process step by step.
      Parameters:
      scanner - - Scanner for capturing user input
      topology - - Topology of the network for device registration and connections
      manager - - NetworkManager to facilitate network-wide operations
      routers - - list of available Router instances
      computers - - list of available Computer instances
      switches - - list of available Switch instances (Layer 2 and 3)
      dhcpServers - - list of available DHCPServer instances
      dnsServers - - list of available DNSServer instances
      webServers - - list of available WebServer instances
      mode - - operational mode (e.g., guided or free); affects how long the menu stays open
